result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Jacob R. Scotty
Current: 417 Maple St., Rib Lake, WI 54470 United States  (Effective: 09-25-2017)
Prior: 7199 N. 2nd Street, Medford, WI 54451 United States

Defendant Jacob R. Scotty in court with attorney Damon P. Stichert.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Victim rights complied with.  Plea of no contest to count 1.  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty of count 1.  Court dismisses and read in Case No.Nos. 16CM94, 15CM92, 16CM119, 16CM78 and 16TR717.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Case No. 16FO293.  Court finds defendant guilty and orders $583.50.  Statement by Attorney Tlusty and Attorney Stichert and defendant.  Court orders sentence withheld probation for one year with conditions of court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; letter of apology to S.N. and M.F.;  counseling as deemed appropriate by probation and comply with a psychiatric evaluation and comply with any recommendations.  Court orders that 16FO293 be added to current payment plan with payments increasing to $50.00 a month beginning February 1, 2016.  -rt

Bail/bond hearing on August 9, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody.  Defendant is in court for a bond hearing for allegedly new charges.  The court ordered that the clerk is to begin bond revocation proceedings in Case Nos. 15CM117 and 15CM92.  - rt

Motion hearing on October 31, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Jury trial on November 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Damon P. Stichert in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The State has filed its standard motions.  No objection by Attorney Stichert to State's motions.  Court grants State's motions.  Attorney Stichert's motion regarding victim's other acts. Victim is to answer - seven.  Motion regarding self defense will be heard at a later date.  State is requesting that 15CM117 be scheduled first as a jury trial and that 15CM92 should be scheduled after 15CM117.  Statement by counsel.  Court orders that 15CM92 should be heard first.  Jury trial scheduled for November 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 31, 2016 at 01:00 pm. - rt

Defendant Jacob R. Scotty in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive reading of complaint.  Plea of not guilty to all charges.  Court orders $500.00 signature bond; booking.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 10:00 am. - rt
